input:

Then the following statement: "he has seen them nationally on basketball" is true, false, or inconclusive?

Take the following as truth: B: and, you know, they just love kittens. A: Yeah. B: They just are fascinated. A: Oh, yeah. B: So she doesn't know that this is a cat yet.
Then the following statement: "this is a cat" is true, false, or inconclusive?

Take the following as truth: Who knows how many quarrels, false accusations, unnecessary dismissals, how many promising careers cut short can be attributed to a butler's slovenliness at the stage of drawing up the staff plan? Indeed, I can say I am in agreement with those who say that the ability to draw up a good staff plan is the cornerstone of any decent butler's skills. I have myself devised many staff plans over the years and I do not believe I am being unduly boastful if I say that very few ever needed amendment.
Then the following statement: "very few plans ever needed amendment" is true, false, or inconclusive?

Take the following as truth: But what we may not know is just what makes somebody a sucker.  What makes people blurt out their credit-card numbers to a caller they 've never heard of? Do they really believe that the number is just for verification and is simply a formality on the road to being a grand-prize winner?
Then the following statement: "the number is just for verification and is simply a formality on the road to being a grand-prize winner" is true, false, or inconclusive?

Take the following as truth: It grew bigger with incredible speed, she was whizzing towards it. She must slow down or she 'd miss it. She took her foot off the accelerator and put it on the brake and as the car slowed she could see now that it was a child a toddler with a red woolly hat on.
Then the following statement: "it was a child" is true, false, or inconclusive?

Take the following as truth: A: No, I don't either. B: Uh, I mean it's, you know it, A: I don't think it's going to change very much
Then the following statement: "it's going to change very much" is true, false, or inconclusive?

Take the following as truth: The lunch trade had mostly disappeared so he wasn't hard to spot. He was at a window table but he was ignoring the river, being deep in conversation with a middle-aged man wearing a suit and a short sheepskin car coat with matching brown suede shoes. Even from this distance you could guess the guy's tailor was based in Dublin.
Then the following statement: "the guy's tailor was based in Dublin" is true, false, or inconclusive?

Take the following as truth: Louise was equally anxious to see this man who had had the power to persuade her niece to go against her upbringing and character and behave so recklessly after such a brief acquaintance. Waiting in the airport she was suddenly aware of Nora striding towards her. She was impressed by how elegant she looked and could tell by her cousin's walk that Nora also felt that she was looking good.
Then the following statement: "that Nora also felt that she was looking good" is true, false, or inconclusive?

Take the following as truth: B: how'd you like to own a piece of property where your lake is going sour because of acid rain. A: Right.  Right. B: It's, uh, really a serious issue for those of us up in this, uh, sector up here. A: um, or do you hypothesize that most of the, uh, smog or air pollution comes from vehicles
Then the following statement: "most of the smog or air pollution comes from vehicles" is true, false, or inconclusive?

Take the following as truth: He left his own number, calling himself Alain - the name of her Malaysian-French ``business manager''. The next day Gina rang. She had obviously not noticed that it was her own number.
Then the following statement: "it was Gina's own number" is true, false, or inconclusive?

Take the following as truth: Obeying his instruction, I proffered my hand, open palm upwards, towards the animal. The ratbird climbed on and began to preen its fur unconcernedly. Nobody will blame me if I say that in the circumstances I became very uneasy.
Then the following statement: "in the circumstances she became very uneasy" is true, false, or inconclusive?

Take the following as truth: The other set being in the pocket of Giovanna's overall from which she now drew them and held them up making it clear that they would be relinquished only upon her death and then only into the hands of Signor Kettering. What had occurred was quite contrary to the wishes of the padrone who would be outraged if he ever got to hear of it. Despite this disastrous beginning however Giovanna would be there in the morning her own family circumstances permitting and she would be much obliged if the Signora would make sure that her children were up and dressed and the breakfast eaten so that she could see that the house was returned to something like the order which Signor Kettering expected of it.
Then the following statement: "the house was returned to something like the order which Signor Kettering expected of it" is true, false, or inconclusive?

Take the following as truth: B: And she got kind of fearful of being on her own. She never really ate very well. It was one thing. She hardly ever took care of herself A: Yeah. B: and she didn't eat. She ate very poor so I think she was, you know, bad, uh, nutrition on top of it. And, uh, she got to the point she didn't want to alone anymore. So, A: So often I think though, elderly people don't realize that their diet is that bad.
Then the following statement: "elderly people's diet is that bad" is true, false, or inconclusive?

Take the following as truth: What had brought Gharr and Ten-huc and Pulvidon to the planet at the same time? Why were all of them so interested in why I was there? And if they somehow suspected that I was picking up something valuable why would any of them try to kill me before the pick-up?
Then the following statement: "she was picking up something valuable" is true, false, or inconclusive?

Take the following as truth: B: And yet, uh, I we-, I hope to see employer based, you know, helping out. You know, child, uh, care centers at the place of employment and things like that, that will help out. A: Uh-huh. B: What do you think, do you think we are, setting a trend?
Then the following statement: "they are setting a trend" is true, false, or inconclusive?

Take the following as truth: A: I suppose so. Let me push the button. B: All right. A: Okay, uh, I guess I'm supposed to be all for switching to the metric system, but, uh, I sense that it's not going to happen anytime soon. B: Yeah, I don't think it's going to happen either,
Then the following statement: "it's going to happen" is true, false, or inconclusive?

Take the following as truth: B: uh, but it's worked out for my family, to have my cake and eat it too, kind of thing. A: Yeah.  Yeah, that's a good deal. Where do you think this is going in the future, I mean, do you think things are going to change,
Then the following statement: "things are going to change" is true, false, or inconclusive?

Take the following as truth: Then they would awake, terrified and sweating, to find themselves in white starched linen, in a comfortable bed, in peaceful England. And all would be well. It may be said that although he survived it the siege nevertheless had a bad effect on the Collector.
Then the following statement: "the siege nevertheless had a bad effect on the Collector" is true, false, or inconclusive?

Take the following as truth: The assassin's tone and bearing were completely confident. If he noticed that Zukov was now edging further to the side widening the arc of fire he did not appear to be troubled.
Then the following statement: "Zukov was edging further to the side" is true, false, or inconclusive?

The thing that I thought was interesting was that the critics, apparently it's going to win everything. B: Really? A: Uh, and I had been told, you know, you wouldn't notice that it was three hours long, and all this, kind of,
Then the following statement: "it was three hours long" is true, false, or inconclusive?

Take the following as truth: She hated to think of his sister lying in hospital waiting for her husband to come to her while all the time he was with Dana. She gripped her hands tightly together. Dana didn't know Berenice was in danger of losing her child.
Then the following statement: "Berenice was in danger of losing her child" is true, false, or inconclusive?

Take the following as truth: B: If, uh, you've some kid uh, who's from a broken family, the schools are supposed to fill that void. It's gotten way beyond uh, you know, teaching classes and maybe providing extracurricular sports activities or something like, oh, were kind of traditionally the school's roles. A: Yeah.  Yeah, it's interesting because, uh, we're just having conversation on this, uh, with a couple of people yesterday. And I was expressing my frustrations that, uh, so many problems, I work in a high school, are that kids don't have a degree of self-discipline which may be reflected in society at large. Uh, and you can't expect in a classroom for a particular course an hour a day to counteract, uh, sixteen or seventeen years of influence at home. B: Right. A: Um, and, it's seen more so because when you call parents up, many parents won't even recognize that there is a problem
Then the following statement: "there is a problem" is true, false, or inconclusive?

Take the following as truth: There was a group of curious onlookers... Marie felt her legs give way beneath her, she sat down on the edge of the pavement, feet in the gutter, doubled-up, sick and winded as if someone had punched her in the stomach. She lifted up her head and looked again. She had watched scenes like this so often in detective films and police series on television that she could hardly believe that this was real life.
Then the following statement: "this was real life" is true, false, or inconclusive?

Take the following as truth: But there was little chance of discovering who had killed him without help. Kelly decided that she had to talk to Annie, even if there was a risk that she would tell her husband. Bill would have a fit if he knew his apprentice was turning supersleuth.
Then the following statement: "Bill's apprentice was turning supersleuth" is true, false, or inconclusive?

They say, hey, we got to do something now. And then start playing the game the way the game should be played toward the last few minutes. B: Yeah. A: So, I don't know I'm looking for a good year. I guess we're always looking for a good year. B: So, obviously though, do you think they're going to do anything in the playoffs to make it to the Super Bowl this year
